-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Quasi-quoter for DBus functions
--   
--   This package contains a quasi-quoter to automatically convert
--   functions of the form <tt>[Variant] -&gt; [Variant]</tt> to functions
--   of the actual types, returning a tuple of the results.
@package dbus-qq
@version 0.1.0

module DBus.QuasiQuoter

-- | A quasi-quoter to convert a function of type <tt>[<a>Variant</a>]
--   -&gt; [<a>Variant</a>]</tt> into a function of a specified static
--   type.
--   
--   This quasi-quoter takes a signature of the form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;dbus types&gt; -&gt; &lt;dbus types&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   Types on the left of the arrow correspond to argument types, while
--   those on the right are return types.
--   
--   The result is a combinator which takes any function of type
--   [<a>Variant</a>] -&gt; [<a>Variant</a>], assumes that its arguments
--   and results are of the specified number and types, and returns a
--   function of the corresponding static type.
--   
--   For example, if <tt>f :: [<a>Variant</a>] -&gt; [<a>Variant</a>]</tt>,
--   
--   <pre>
--   [<a>dbus</a>| i s -&gt; s a{uv} |] f
--   </pre>
--   
--   has type
--   
--   <pre>
--   Int -&gt; String -&gt; (String, <a>Map</a> <a>Word32</a> <a>Variant</a>)
--   </pre>
dbus :: QuasiQuoter

-- | A generalized version of the <a>dbus</a> quasi-quoter which works on
--   functions of type <tt>[<a>Variant</a>] -&gt; f [<a>Variant</a>]</tt>,
--   for any <a>Functor</a> <tt>f</tt>.
dbusF :: QuasiQuoter
